Title: Privacy Data Analyst - Fluent German
Description:
Work Type: In Office
Location: Gdańsk or Krakow Office

The Privacy Data Analyst is responsible for enforcing the policies for our clients products by analyzing requests under European Law Legislations from lawyers and private individuals by reviewing and processing privacy requests. You will also be responsible for handling users’ privacy requests for different workflows, following the client’s guidelines, which allow you to make sound decisions. You will have a thirst for knowledge, impeccable judgment and be comfortable operating in a fast paced, dynamic environment.

Maintain a high level of quality in each case that you review
Achieve weekly productivity deliverables as part of daily workflow
Effectively collaborate with team members on a range of projects to improve internal efficiency and effectiveness

Fluency in written and spoken German and English is essential

Title: Data Analyst with Turkish, Pricing and Performance Team
Description:
Job Description

Do you feel like taking the journey in the fin-tech world? The job of a Data Analyst is one where specific experience or background is not needed. Motivation and curiosity are what we're looking for. In the beginning, we'll provide you with training to make your first months in the company smooth.

Compensation

You will receive the annual gross salary of 60 000 PLN. You will also be entitled to a bonus scheme and additional benefits that we offer to Refinitiv colleagues.

Your Tasks

Data is the heart of our company, and we need you to keep our heart healthy. Our clients: financial institutions, banks, and corporations rely on the quality of the information we provide them via our products.

So, think that you are the first person that sources the data for our clients. It can be bonds or funds, corporate actions, or economic indicators. In fact, there're plenty of financial types of data that we manage.

A major part of the day is when you research the Internet sourcing information; visiting official pages of global companies and institutions. You also rely on our internal databases and products. And last but not least, you don't work on your own only. You talk to colleagues in Gdynia and teams located in the UK, US, India, and other countries. And you use cutting-edge technologies to allow your conversations to be exciting.

In Short, Your Job Will Be About

Collecting, processing and verifying specific financial information; text-based or number-based data
Doing research on financial information
Working with large databases (maintaining, updating, improving)

What is more, you join projects to stimulate your ambitions of an early professional and let you develop your career.

Your Qualifications

Very good knowledge of English and at least intermediate knowledge of Turkish
Motivation to begin a career in finance
Attention to details because you will take care of a number of data and information
Good prioritization skills because you will handle various tasks
Curiosity to learn because we want you to stay and grow with our company

You Receive

Development: e-learning platform, a range of workshops and international projects
Onboarding: structured training and buddy support
Information: access to real-time economic data
Diversity: colleagues from 40 countries [working in Gdynia]
Charity: 2 additional days off for voluntary jobs
Perks: multisport card, private medical healthcare, employee assistance program, pension plan,
Office: chill-out room with video games, massage chairs and ping-pong table.
Activities: sports teams and social events to join
Future: corporate pension plan and employee insurance

Title: Data Analyst with Spanish or Balkan language (OA team)
Data Analyst/Custom Insights
Description:
Company Description

We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.

Job Description

Verisk Insurance Services Office (ISO) in Krakow is a team of 40 passionate analysts.

We work on various Insurance Data Analytics projects. Depending on the team we are using SQL, Python or R. We keep developing new solutions for our insurance clients and collaborate closely with our international colleagues. We work with analytic products at various stages of data lifecycle (planning, collecting, processing, analyzing, verifying, and publishing).

We are looking to grow this amazing group of analysts. We hire people with broad analytical skillset with innovative mindset and a focus on details, who are ready to continue or start their career in data analytics.

Working in Data Analytics at ISO means:

Creating, modifying, and executing computer programs to extract, transforming and summarizing data.

Understanding and taking ownership of our business/data/analytics processes, and recommending improvements in data management, error identification, quality control, process automation, or analytic techniques.

Presenting your analyses, ideas, progress and results to your manager and colleagues.

Developing an understanding of the US Property & Casualty insurance business and Verisk Analytics’ business practices, products, and data sources.

Assisting in building and maintaining proper documentation, procedures, and guidelines.

Contributing to the creation of detailed project plans to ensure projects are completed on time.

The Role Includes
Working closely with project leads to share insights and discuss additional needs.
Creating the foundation of products for the insurance industry and select insurance carriers
Assisting in creating industry and customer-specific reports and insights, for both personal and commercial lines.
Working closely with the Product, Data and Operations teams in the development, implementation, maintenance and regular distribution of useful solutions that will have high visibility at the leadership and executive level.
Qualifications

Our position requires:

Practical knowledge of Excel, SQL and mix of:
Ability to analyze data from business point of view.
Python, R or PowerBI is a plus (not mandatory)
Practical experience with large (>100,000 row) datasets analysis.
Additional Qualification
Detail-oriented aptitude in quantitative and qualitative data analysis, with strong logical, problem solving, and decision-making skills.
Fluency in English is required.
Additional Information

In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list.

For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.

Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.

Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.
Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other
Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes
Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries
Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger
